{{ infobox football match | event = 2008-09 Hazfi Cup | team1 = [[Rah Ahan F.C.|Rah Ahan]] | team2 = [[Zob Ahan Isfahan FC|Zob Ahan]] | team1association = | team2association = | team1score = 2 | team2score = 5 | firstleg = First leg | team1score1 = 1 | team2score1 = 0 | date1 = May 18, 2009 | stadium1 = [[Rah Ahan Stadium]] | city1 = [[Ekbatan]] | attendance1 = 5,000 | referee1 = Khodadad Afsharian | secondleg = Second leg | team1score2 = 1 | team2score2 = 5 | date2 = May 22, 2009 | stadium2 = [[Foolad Shahr Stadium]] | city2 = [[Fooladshahr]] | attendance2 = 15,000 | referee2 = [[Saeed Mozafarizadeh]] | previous = [[2008 Hazfi Cup Final|2008]] | next = [[2010 Hazfi Cup Final|2010]] }} The '''2009 Hazfi Cup Final''' was a [[Two-legged tie|two-legged]] [[association football|football]] tie in order to determine the 2008â09 Hazfi Cup champion of [[Iran|Iranian]] football clubs. [[Rah Ahan F.C.|Rah Ahan]] faced [[Zob Ahan Isfahan FC|Zob Ahan]] in this final game. The first leg took place on May 18, 2009 at 17:00 [[Iran Standard Time|local time]] ([[UTC+3:30]]) at [[Rah Ahan Stadium]] in [[Ekbatan]] and the second leg took place on May 22, 2009 at 17:00 [[Iran Standard Time|local time]] ([[UTC+3:30]]) at [[Foolad Shahr Stadium]], [[Fooladshahr]]. == Format == The rules for the final were exactly the same as the one in the previous knockout rounds. The tie was contested over two legs with [[Away goals rule|away goals]] deciding the winner if the two teams were level on goals after the second leg. If the teams could still not be separated at that stage, then [[extra time]] would have been played with a [[Penalty shootout (association football)|penalty shootout]] (taking place if the teams were still level after extra time). == Route to the final == {{details|2008â09 Hazfi Cup}} {| style="width:100%; text-align:center;" |- style="vertical-align:top; background:#9cf;" !colspan=4 style="width:1*"|Rah Ahan !Round !colspan=4 style="width:1*"|Zob Ahan |- style="vertical-align:top; background:#c1e0ff;" |Opponent |Result |H/A |Rah Ahan goalscorers ||Second stage |Opponent |Result |H/A |Zob Ahan goalscorers |- | [[Petroshimi Tabriz F.C.|Petroshimi Tabriz]] | 3–1 | A | [[Sohrab Entezari]], [[Alireza Noormohammadi]], [[Mohsen Mirabi]] | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|1/16 Final | [[Shirin Faraz F.C.|Shirin Faraz Kermanshah]] | 4–1 | H | [[Igor JosÃ© Marigo de Castro|Igor Castro]], [[Hassan Ashjari]] (2), [[Mohammad Mansouri (born 1979)|Mohammad Mansouri]] |- | [[Bargh Shiraz F.C.|Bargh Shiraz]] | 4–1 | H | [[Davoud Haghi]] (2), [[Mojtaba Zarei]], [[Ahmad Momenzadeh]] | style="background:#c1e0ff;"| 1/8 Final | [[F.C. Aboomoslem|Aboomoslem Mashhad]] | 1–0 | A | [[Mohammad Salsali]] |- | [[Teraktor Sazi F.C.|Teraktor Sazi Tabriz]] | 1–0 | A | [[Sohrab Entezari]] | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Quarter-Final | [[Foolad F.C.|Foolad Ahvaz]] | 3–0 | H | [[Ghasem Hadadifar]] (2), [[Mohammad Reza Khalatbari]] |- | [[PAS Hamedan F.C.|Pas Hamedan]] | 1–0 | H | [[Mojtaba Zarei]] | style="background:#c1e0ff;"|Semi-Final | [[Saba Qom F.C.|Saba Qom]] | 0–0 (5-4) | A | |} == Final Summary == {{TwoLegStart}} {{TwoLegResult|[[Rah Ahan F.C.|Rah Ahan]]|| 2-5 |'''[[Zob Ahan Isfahan FC|Zob Ahan]]'''|| 1-0 | 1-5 |winner=2 }} |}
